title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 56.11 - Destruction or mutilation by pilot of official or authorized postings in pilot office, shore station or pilot boat; fine or suspension
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 56.11 - Destruction or mutilation by pilot of official or authorized postings in pilot office, shore station or pilot boat; fine or suspension

State Regulations

Any pilot destroying or mutilating by erasure or otherwise
any memorial, petition, or other paper posted up in a pilot office or shore
station, or on board a pilot boat, by order of the commissioners or by order of
the duly authorized executive officers or committee of any association or other
body of pilots licensed by the commissioners of which he may be a member, shall
be subject to a fine of $25 or to suspension, as the commissioners may
determine. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21

56.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
